verses.verse: Moreover Ahithophel<WH302> said<WH559> unto Absalom<WH53>, Let me now choose out<WH977> twelve<WH8147> thousand<WH505> men<WH376>, and I will arise<WH6965> and pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> David<WH1732> this night<WH3915>:

And I will come<WH935> upon him while he is weary<WH3023> and weak<WH7504> handed<WH3027>, and will make him afraid<WH2729>: and all the people<WH5971> that are with him shall flee<WH5127>; and I will strike<WH5221> the king only<WH4428>:
And I will bring back<WH7725> all the people<WH5971> unto you<WH376>: the man whom you seek<WH1245> is as if all returned<WH7725>: so all the people<WH5971> shall be in peace<WH7965>.
And the saying<WH1697> pleased<WH3474> Absalom<WH53> well<WH5869>, and all the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>.
Then said<WH559> Absalom<WH53>, Call<WH7121> now Hushai<WH2365> the Archite<WH757> also<WH8085>, and let us hear likewise what he says<WH6310>.

And when Hushai<WH2365> was come<WH935> to Absalom<WH53>, Absalom<WH53> spoke<WH559> unto him<WH559>, saying, Ahithophel<WH302> has spoken<WH1696> after this manner<WH1697>: shall we do<WH6213> after his saying<WH1697>? if not<WH1696>; speak you.
And Hushai<WH2365> said<WH559> unto Absalom<WH53>, The counsel<WH6098> that Ahithophel<WH302> has given<WH3289> is not good<WH2896> at this time<WH6471>.

For<WH559>, said Hushai<WH2365>, you know<WH3045> your father<WH1> and his men<WH582>, that they be mighty men<WH1368>, and they are bitter<WH4751> in their minds<WH5315>, as a bear<WH1677> robbed<WH7909> of her whelps in the field<WH7704>: and your father<WH1> is a man<WH376> of war<WH4421>, and will not lodge<WH3885> with the people<WH5971>.

Behold<WH2244>, he is hid now in some<WH259> pit<WH6354>, or in some<WH259> other place<WH4725>: and it will come to pass<WH5307>, when some of them are overthrown at the first<WH8462>, that whoever<WH8085> hears<WH8085> it will say<WH559>, There is a slaughter<WH4046> among the people<WH5971> that follow<WH310> Absalom<WH53>.

And he also that is valiant<WH1121>, whose heart<WH3820> is as the heart<WH3820> of a lion<WH738>, shall utterly<WH4549> melt<WH4549>: for all Israel<WH3478> knows<WH3045> that your father<WH1> is a mighty man<WH1368>, and they which are with him are valiant<WH2428> men<WH1121>.

Therefore I counsel<WH3289> that all Israel<WH3478> be generally<WH622> gathered<WH622> unto you<WH1835>, from Dan even to Beer<WH884>–sheba, as the sand<WH2344> that is by the sea<WH3220> for multitude<WH7230>; and that you go<WH1980> to battle<WH7128> in your own person<WH6440>.

So shall we come<WH935> upon him in some<WH259> place<WH4725> where he shall be found<WH4672>, and we will light<WH5168> upon him as the dew<WH2919> falls<WH5307> on the ground<WH127>: and of him and of all the men<WH582> that are with him there shall not be left<WH3498> so much as<WH1571> one<WH259>.

Moreover<WH518>, if he be gotten<WH622> into a city<WH5892>, then shall all Israel<WH3478> bring<WH5375> ropes<WH2256> to that city<WH5892>, and we will pull<WH5498> it into the river<WH5158>, until there be not one<WH1571> small stone<WH6872> found there<WH4672>.

And Absalom<WH53> and all the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> said<WH559>, The counsel<WH6098> of Hushai<WH2365> the Archite<WH757> is better<WH2896> than the counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel<WH302>. For the Lord<WH3068> had appointed<WH6680> to defeat<WH6565> the good<WH2896> counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel<WH302>, to the intent<WH5668> that the Lord<WH3068> might bring<WH935> evil<WH7451> upon Absalom<WH53>.

Then said<WH559> Hushai<WH2365> unto Zadok<WH6659> and to Abiathar<WH54> the priests<WH3548>, Thus and thus did Ahithophel<WH302> counsel<WH3289> Absalom<WH53> and the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>; and thus and thus have I counseled<WH3289>.

Now therefore send<WH7971> quickly<WH4120>, and tell<WH5046> David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, Lodge<WH3885> not this night<WH3915> in the plains<WH6160> of the wilderness<WH4057>, but speedily<WH5674> pass over<WH5674>; lest the king<WH4428> be swallowed up<WH1104>, and all the people that are with him<WH5971>.

Now Jonathan<WH3083> and Ahimaaz<WH290> stayed<WH5975> by En<WH5883>–rogel; for they might<WH3201> not be seen<WH7200> to come<WH935> into the city<WH5892>: and a wench<WH8198> went<WH1980> and told<WH5046> them<WH3212>; and they went and told<WH5046> king<WH4428> David<WH1732>.

Nevertheless a lad<WH5288> saw<WH7200> them<WH5046>, and told Absalom<WH53>: but they went<WH3212> both<WH8147> of them away quickly<WH4120>, and came<WH935> to a man<WH376>'s house<WH1004> in Bahurim<WH980>, which had a well<WH875> in his court<WH2691>; where<WH8033> they went down<WH3381>.

And the woman<WH802> took<WH3947> and spread<WH6566> a covering<WH4539> over the well<WH875>'s mouth<WH6440>, and spread<WH7849> ground corn<WH7383> on it<WH1697>; and the thing was not known<WH3045>.

And when Absalom<WH53>'s servants<WH5650> came<WH935> to the woman<WH802> to the house<WH1004>, they said<WH559>, Where is Ahimaaz<WH290> and Jonathan<WH3083>? And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> unto them<WH5674>, They be gone over the brook<WH4323> of water<WH4325>. And when they had sought<WH1245> and could not find<WH4672> them<WH7725>, they returned to Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And it came to pass<WH310>, after they were departed<WH3212>, that they came up<WH5927> out of the well<WH875>, and went<WH3212> and told<WH5046> king<WH4428> David<WH1732>, and said<WH559> unto David<WH1732>, Arise<WH6965>, and pass quickly<WH4120> over<WH5674> the water<WH4325>: for thus has Ahithophel<WH302> counseled against you<WH3289>.

Then David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and all the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH5674>, and they passed over Jordan<WH3383>: by the morning<WH1242> light<WH216> there lacked<WH5737> not one<WH259> of them that was not gone over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383>.

And when Ahithophel<WH302> saw<WH7200> that his counsel<WH6098> was not followed<WH6213>, he saddled<WH2280> his donkey<WH2543>, and arose<WH6965>, and went him home<WH3212> to his house<WH1004>, to his city<WH5892>, and put his household<WH1004> in order<WH6680>, and hanged<WH2614> himself<WH4191>, and died, and was buried<WH6912> in the tomb<WH6913> of his father<WH1>.
Then David<WH1732> came<WH935> to Mahanaim<WH4266>. And Absalom<WH53> passed over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383>, he and all the men<WH376> of Israel with him<WH3478>.

And Absalom<WH53> made<WH7760> Amasa<WH6021> captain of the army<WH6635> instead of Joab<WH3097>: which Amasa<WH6021> was a man<WH376>'s son<WH1121>, whose name<WH8034> was Ithra<WH3501> an Israelite<WH3481>, that went in<WH935> to Abigail<WH26> the daughter<WH1323> of Nahash<WH5176>, sister<WH269> to Zeruiah<WH6870> Joab<WH3097>'s mother<WH517>.
So Israel<WH3478> and Absalom<WH53> pitched<WH2583> in the land<WH776> of Gilead<WH1568>.

And it came to pass<WH1732>, when David was come<WH935> to Mahanaim<WH4266>, that Shobi<WH7629> the son<WH1121> of Nahash<WH5176> of Rabbah<WH7237> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and Machir<WH4353> the son<WH1121> of Ammiel<WH5988> of Lo<WH3810>–debar, and Barzillai<WH1271> the Gileadite<WH1569> of Rogelim<WH7274>,

Brought<WH5066> beds<WH4904>, and basins<WH5592>, and earthen<WH3335> vessels<WH3627>, and wheat<WH2406>, and barley<WH8184>, and flour<WH7058>, and parched<WH7039> corn<WH6321>, and beans, and lentil<WH5742>, and parched grain<WH7039>,
